featured.text: This group of islands off the coast of Ecuador has recently contracted Argentine Corporación America to manage the redevelopment of the airport on the island of Baltra.
The skydiver managed to land safely after jumping out of the aircraft, even though her _____ failed to open in midair.
Churchill, however, managed to get the better of this exchange.
All the obstacles of reality can be set aside and you are able to accomplish tasks that you could never manage in waking reality.

other.text: With a DJ playing various kinds of music rather than just rap, and a mix of clothing labels designed more for taste and fashion than for a precise age, department stores have managed to appeal to successful middle-aged women 20 losing their younger customers.
She managed to reach There, Popole discovered judo, from which he Turkey through Lebanon.
In view of all these strengths, in the 1930s the United States and Canada undertook a research project in which they managed to breed an especially nutritious soybean with a high oil content.
We even managed to visit an aboriginal village in the forest.

definition.en_def: To be in charge of or control something.
definition.example: She was hired to manage the new project.
